text: Robert Quinlan "Bob" Costas (born March 22, 1952 in Queens, New York City, New York) is a Sports commentator. He currently works with NBC Sports and MLB Network. Costas has hosted nine Olympic Games. He has won 26 Emmy Awards. He used to work with HBO hosting Inside the NFL, Costas Now, and On the Record with Bob Costas. He called games for the American Basketball Association's Spirits of St. Louis, Missouri Tigers men's basketball, Chicago Bulls telecast on WGN-TV, and NFL and National Basketball Association games for CBS. He has hosted and did play-by-play for these sports Sports on NBC: *Thoroughbred Racing *Olympics *Tennis *Golf *National Football League *College football *College basketball *National Basketball Association *National Hockey League *Major League Baseball Costas is a play-by-play announcer for MLB Network. == References == Category:Major League Baseball broadcasters Category:National Football League broadcasters Category:National Basketball Association broadcasters Category:National Hockey League broadcasters Category:College football broadcasters Category:College basketball broadcasters Category:Golf broadcasters Category:Tennis broadcasters Category:Olympic Games broadcasters Category:Horse Racing broadcasters Category:Living people Category:1952 births Category:Emmy Award winners
